sessions.title: The Solace of You
sessions.description: How finding solace in myself gave me the foundation to live and work unapologetically.

sessions.title: You Belong Here
sessions.description: Inspirational talk will help attendees learn how to foster their own sense of belonging as opposed to waiting for others to include you.

sessions.title: Navigating Your Non-Traditional Tech Journey
sessions.description: As students graduating from bootcamps and career transitioners pivoting from non-traditional backgrounds, many of us easily become discouraged and overwhelmed once our job hunt begins. Career services can sometimes make empty promises and overzealous claims of quick employment once these programs end. This was what I faced when I completed my first bootcamp in 2019. This talk aims to share some key priorities that emerging developers need to focus on at every stage of their learning journey, even beyond their first role.

sessions.title: The Importance of DEI in Product Design
sessions.description: A 45 mins session with 15 mins for Q&A. I will discuss Design as an essential part of everyday life - from the products we use to the spaces we inhabit. As such, design must be representative of the world, we live in. A lack of diversity in design can lead to products and spaces that are not inclusive or accessible to everyone. It can also result in a homogenous perspective that does not reflect the global nature of our world.

sessions.title: How To Leverage Your Neurodivergence At Work
sessions.description:
The most successful people in life share one thing in common- they understand how to leverage their innate strengths. 

Neurodivergence is a gift, and for some it can even be a superpower! Leaning into your brain’s unique tendencies can help you move through life with more ease and confidence. When you know how to embrace and leverage your neurodivergence, you can show up and show out no matter what challenges you face. 

Through this talk you will:
1. Understand 3 steps to truly leverage the strengths of neurodistinction
2. Learn how to more effectively advocate for accommodations at work
3. Discover actionable methods to collaborate with your neurodivergence rather than fight against it

sessions.title: Intro to Web Accessibility for Web developers and Designers
sessions.description: An introduction on the fundamentals of web accessibility. This talk covers why web accessibility matters, what to consider when building and designing web pages and simple to implement manual and automated testing tools.

sessions.title: When to pivot: the hunt for product-market fit
sessions.description: In a world where product/market fit reigns supreme, how do you know when you’ve got it? More importantly, how will you know when to pivot? B.’s talk will define product/market fit, provide examples of product/market fit, and share insights on when to double down or when to move away from an idea.

sessions.title: Mic Check: What Developers can learn from Hip Hop
sessions.description: This talk looks at the parallels of the rise of hip hop and Python to the mainstream. We'll look at challenges both faced explore what the Python and greater tech community can learn as we face new challenges today.

sessions.title: Data Engineering Demystified
sessions.description: In a world where each of us is generating and consuming an increasing amount of data every day, someone has to be able to wrangle, process, and make sense of that data. That someone is a data engineer. But what exactly does data engineering entail? This talk will cover the basics of what a data engineer does, some common tools they use to do it, and what you can do to get started down the path of data engineering.

sessions.title: 4 Steps to Becoming a UX/UI Designer
sessions.description: Interested in a career in UX but not sure how to go about it? I'm outlining the four major steps you will take on your journey to landing that role. Be prepared to take notes as this is not just a talk but you'll be preparing your career journey action plan.

sessions.title: Using self-care to tackle burnout and stress.
sessions.description:
This session will focus on equipping leaders and employees with the tools they need to implement self-care at work and home. Through structured experiences, this interactive session invites participants to build skills to thrive at work and reduce burnout. Participants will identify and evaluate their strategies and create a personal self-care plan. Participants will leave the workshop with a clear plan and specific skills that will allow them to thrive at work. All attendees will understand the following:


1. Understand burnout and stressors.
2. Recognize the warning signals of burnout.
3. The definition of self-care and the importance of having a go-to plan.
4. Start from where they are and using powerful tools to improve their wellbeing.

sessions.title: From Zero to Monitored
sessions.description: This talk will cover some of the basics of how to get started with metrics and getting your simple web application to have monitoring. Not only will we cover which metrics are best for SLIs and when and what your SLOs should be, but also when to incorporate logs and tracing, as well as metrics. Participants will expect to know some observability basics and how to use the monitoring to understand system health and avoid some potential incidents.

sessions.title: Right Within: A Discussion with Minda Harts
sessions.description: We are pleased to have Minda Harts join us for a conversation about being our authentic selves in a professional world that wants us to take up less space.

sessions.title: Beyond the buzzwords: Turning “DEI” into action
sessions.description: Session on going beyond diversity to learning to empower members and allies to make a difference in the circles they find themselves.

sessions.title: Open Source for Purpose and Profit
sessions.description: In this talk, Lyn Muldrow, Senior Developer Advocate at Tidelift, shares actionable tips on getting into open source in a way that is both fulfilling to your soul and your pockets.

sessions.title: How to Build a GPT-3 App with Nextjs, React and GitHub Copilot
sessions.description:
Join me for a fun and informative session on how to build your own AI-powered web application. 

You'll learn how to use OpenAI API (GPT-3), Nextjs, React and GitHub Copilot to build an app that automagically✨ generates nutrition facts for any recipe. 

Whether you're a seasoned developer or just starting out, let's dip our toes into the world of AI-powered coding and web development.

sessions.title: Breaking the Barrier to a Tech Career : Microsoft
sessions.description: Are you interested in getting into technology or upskilling your current role? This session will be for you. We will dive in to Why? How? and Who.

sessions.title: PM vs SWE/SRE wars
sessions.description: Building relationships between the different players within the Software Development Lifecycle of a global app

sessions.title: Milieu: How higher education can transition underserved communities
sessions.description: Leveraging the Illinois University system and connecting Chicago State (technically Chicago’s only adjacent HBCU) in a way that encourages student led/created funds and attracts more founders to the Chicago innovation community.

sessions.title: Why are people developing inside containers? How Codespaces takes containerization to the next leve
sessions.description:
In March 2013, Solomon Hykes and his cofounders revolutionized how we do software development with an open source platform called Docker. Thanks to Docker, engineers can create tools, like GitHub Codespaces, that enable us to code in a development container hosted in the cloud. In this talk, we'll explore the answers to a few questions: 
- What are containers?
- Why are people developing inside containers?
- How do you use GitHub Codespaces?

speakers.bio: Africa Mincey is an accessibility engineer and occupational therapist with a passion for making websites usable for people of all abilities. As an occupational therapist she helped individuals with acute injuries and disabilities increase independence with rehabilitative exercise and  assistive technology tools. She transitioned away from direct patient care to work as a Web developer building full stack web applications. She now specializes in analyzing and testing software for adherence to the digital accessibility laws covered under the Americans With Disabilities Act.

Ajuna Kyaruzi works in Developer Relations at Datadog and cares about using software to help people sustainably run large-scale systems, focusing on Incident Managements and SLOs. She loves community building and volunteers with multiple mentorship programs aimed at helping early career folks break into tech, and ensuring they have successful careers. Previously she worked at Google as a Software Engineer on Google Maps and as a Site Reliability Engineer on Google Cloud.

Highly focused on transforming underserved communities into capital markets, Alaxandria works at the intersection of Community Development; Technology; and Venture Capital. Known as a super-connector and ecosystem builder, Alaxandria spends the majority of her time serving as a conduit for local Black and Brown founders and those interested in entering the Chicago market. Currently, she has her hands busy building online communities such as Goodie Nation and organizing culturally relevant tech opportunities for the South Side via Black Tech Migrants, a subsidiary brand of the ChiTechCLLCT.

Anthony is a data engineer turned software engineer who loves working on backend platforms and nerding out about all things data. Currently working on the Growth Data Engineering team at Netflix, his previous experience includes time as a software engineer in Content Engineering at Netflix, as well as time at Mailchimp, Cerner, and Bank of America to name a few. Anthony holds Computer Science degrees from both the historic Clark Atlanta University, as well as DePaul University, and has further expanded his expertise with Kubernetes, Apache Cassandra, and Google Cloud Data Engineering certifications. Anthony is extremely passionate about mentoring and supporting those from underrepresented communities in tech and is always open to a coffee chat and meeting someone new. You can always find Anthony on various social platforms as @antculver.

As a seasoned User Experience and User Interface Designer, Ashley Janelle focuses on designing customer centered experiences that target her users everyday challenges. At Amazon, Ashley taps into user needs while designing solutions that allow them to save time, money, and increase their productivity. 

As a UX coach and course creator, she’s developed an online course, “Learn UX Online in 16 Weeks” to help aspiring UX designers go from beginner to experienced UX Designers to land jobs at top companies. Using her UX expertise and passion for working with people, Ashley’s not only helped others land their dream roles, but build the confidence to become successful UX Designers.

Astrid is a Project Manager with experience across different industries. She supports teams throughout the life cycle of a project by first framing suitable, realistic projects, adding value beyond cost and schedule and making a project collaborative, exciting and fulfilling for the team.

Athena marries neuroscience and spirituality to bring embodied yet practical insight to the stage. She is passionate about showing neurodivergent creators how to develop supportive practices that help them navigate uncertainty with confidence.

Athena hosts the What Happens In Between podcast which highlights the unsexy middle bits of creating something meaningful.

She earned her degree from the Wharton School at University of Pennsylvania and utilizes a variety of modalities in her work. 

You can learn more about Athena at athenasayaka.com !

B. is an award-winning product strategist, podcast host, startup advisor and investor, and executive coach, as well as a respected thought leader in agile technologies who approaches every problem with strategy, curiosity, and genuine authenticity. As a dedicated enthusiast of sustainable processes, great products, and culture development, B.’s fierce drive to promote diversity in tech and impact real authentic change continues to define both their work and life outside of their work. B. is a proud graduate of Northwestern University with a deep background in history, in addition to an MBA and master of information systems from Robert Morris University. B. gives back to various organizations by being the Vice Chair & Secretary on the Board of Directors at Howard Brown Health, one of the top 3 largest LGBTQ community health centers in the country, Vice President & Secretary on the Board of Directors at the YWCA of Metropolitan Chicago, and Board of Directors of the Northwestern Alumni Association. In 2022, B. Was honored as one of the Queer 50 from Fast Company, 35 Hero Advocate Executives by Involve People and Yahoo Finance UK, and a finalist for 2022 LGBTQNation heroes of the year.

Leader, Educator, Author, TEDx speaker, and Cultural Disruptor, Beth Ruffin is the CEO of The Everyday Inclusionist, a boutique consulting firm focused on teaching leaders how to include themselves and others.  She spent 20 years in Corporate America before realizing her dream of entrepreneurship. Committed to making our world more inclusive, Beth is host of the “You Belong Here with Beth Ruffin” podcast, focused on helping women realize their true potential.  Beth is also a published author.  Her first book, Get Up, details her journey to self-acceptance.  Her second book, You Belong Here, explores the topic of Self Inclusion.  She is the Chair of the Women’s Rights & Empowerment Network (WREN) Board of Directors and Co-Chair of the Economic Impact Committee of the Richland County Alumnae Chapter of Delta Sigma Theta Incorporated.  Beth lives in South Carolina with her daughter and cat.

Chelsea Hinds-Charles is a Platform Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), who firmly believes that everyone is capable of being an engineer. She specializes in enhancing the reliability, scalability and performance of iOS, Android and Web development environments across hybrid on-prem and cloud Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment production infrastructure. After immigrating to New York City from Guyana, South America, her interest in understanding how things worked was piqued as she was fascinated by the subway trains. This was the foundation of what led to a problem solving career in systems engineering. Chelsea had the opportunity to work at many companies in various industries, such as Twitter,  Southwest Airlines, Walt Disney World and National Grid Utilities. Through these experiences, Chelsea continues to build and transform technical teams for success. However, her true passion is to fulfill her legacy of making engineering available to our people through volunteering and teaching tech in her local community. And, encouraging underrepresented engineers to be at the table, and not just in the building.

A Microsoft evangelist with over twelve years of IT roles. Military veteran with a background in Cloud Security and Virtualization. Now providing Architecture consulting and career transition coaching.
speakers.tagLine: Senior Microsoft Architect and Career Coach

speakers.bio:
Fonz Morris is a fierce advocate of the self-taught designer and entrepreneur.

Since 2020, Fonz Morris has been the Lead Product Designer for Global Conversion at Netflix. Before joining Netflix, he led a design team at Coursera. His previous roles have covered design positions at large corporations, including Comcast, and he is the founder of two innovative tech start-ups, including MyChannel and MyArtistDNA. 

Fonz has spoken at AfroTech, How Design Live, and Event Apart. He mentors design students through various organizations, including California College of the Arts and General Assembly’s UX Design Bootcamp. Fonz has contributed his knowledge to conferences, including AfroTech, UX Fest, UXDX, Rethink, Made In the Future, and State of Black Design. He is on the Design Thinking board and the strategic planning committee at [school name]. He is an advising partner or consulting with venture capital firms First Round, Floodgate, and Signalfire, helping guide the up and coming designers and self-starters.

He has continued his education in the VC sector with recent certifications from Stanford University Graduate School of Business, Black VC, UC Berkeley Extension, and VC University, of which he was a 2022 Cohort 11 Scholarship recipient.

Fonz was born in Brooklyn. He has worked in tech and design on both coasts of the United States, in Philadelphia, New York, Atlanta, Washington D.C., and California.
speakers.tagLine: Lead Product Designer, Global Conversion Netflix

speakers.bio: Janackeh Blackwell is an open source fellow with Sauce Labs. Previously she has completed bootcamps with General Assembly, Generation USA and Bitwise Industries. She is also the organizer and founder of Black Tech Denver, a tech networking incubator for underrepresented communities in the Denver & Boulder Colorado areas.

Jay Miller is a Senior Cloud Advocate at Microsoft based out of San Diego, California. Jay has spent the last decade podcasting and advocating for career changers, mental-health, and historically excluded folks in tech.

Kedasha is a Developer Advocate at Github where she enjoys creating content to engage the developer community.👩🏽‍💻 Prior to her transition to the world of tech, she worked as a social worker in various government agencies and attended an intense coding bootcamp in 2019 to make her transition to software development. 

She finds joy in helping others learn about the tech industry and creates technical content on Instagram & Tiktok for new and aspiring technologists at @itsthatladydev. She has spoken at conferences, online workshops and multiple podcasts about her experience as a software developer. 
When she's not creating content online, you can find her in the kitchen cooking up her favorite Jamaican dish.

Lola Adeyemo is a TEDx speaker, workshop facilitator, consultant, and resourceful leader who believes in and actively promotes inclusive leadership and advocates for employee engagement in the workforce. A scientist by discipline with over 13+ years working across global organizations in the biotechnology and life sciences industries, she is working towards her business doctorate with a dissertation focus on inclusive leadership strategies. Adeyemo is the founder and CEO of EQI Mindset, a management consulting company focused on Team and Employee Resource Group optimization, and the founder of the non-profit Immigrants in Corporate Inc. Her podcast “The Immigrants in Corporate Podcast” and her recent book “Thriving in Intersectionality: Immigrants, Belonging, and Corporate America” supports the non-profit mission and explores being an immigrant and its intersection with other under-represented identities within the corporate work culture in America. Adeyemo serves on the board of Girls Inc. of San Diego County and supports a few other organizations aligned with her passion.
speakers.tagLine: Elevating Underrepresented Voices in the Corporate workplace

speakers.bio: Lyn Muldrow is a Senior Maintainer Advocate at Tidelift, helping open source maintainers get paid for their contribution to the community. She previously contributed to building projects as an engineer at LinkedIn, educated new generations of technologists as Lead Instructor at Flatiron School, and maintained open source projects through her work at DigitalOcean. Lyn is passionate about increasing diversity in the open source community, and volunteers with organizations like Out In Tech to increase opportunities for all. In her free time, Lyn enjoys gardening, hanging with her Maine Coon, and going on travel adventures across the country with her family.

Michael Brown has 25 years of software development experience primarily as a consultant. He has designed and developed solutions for a multitude of organizations both public and private from small startups to fortune five hundred companies across an array of industries. He has recently joined Microsoft where he brings his experience and expertise to help customers leverage Azure services to create solutions.

Minda Harts is the bestselling and award-winning author of The Memo: What Women of Color Need to Know to Secure a Seat at the Table as well as Right Within: How to Heal from Racial Trauma in the Workplace, and her first YA book, You Are More Than Magic. She is a highly sought-after speaker and thought-leader, frequently presenting on the topics of advancing women of color, leadership, diversity, and management at companies like Nike, Google, JP Morgan, Aspen Ideas Festival, Dreamforce, The Atlantic Festival, Forbes Inclusion in The Workplace, and DraftKings to name a few. Minda is an assistant professor of public service at NYU's Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service and the founder of The Memo LLC, a career development company. In 2020, Minda was named by LinkedIn as the #1 Top Voice for Equity in the Workplace. In 2022, She was named by Business Insider as one the the top 100 People Transforming Business. Additionally, Minda was chosen by Marie Claire Magazine in 2022 to participate in Power Trip, where the year’s Top Women Movers and Shakers participate in an all-expense paid trip to network with each other. She has a weekly career podcast for women of color, titled Secure the Seat.

Rizel is a Junior Developer Advocate at GitHub. She moonlights as an Advisor at G{Code} House, an organization aimed at teaching women of color and non-binary people of color to code. Rizel believes in leveraging vulnerability, honesty, and kindness as means to educate early-career developers.

Dr. Tamara Beckford is a board-certified emergency physician, wife, and mom. She is the CEO of UR Caring Docs, where she helps help companies create amazing cultures and reduce employee burnout through curated self-care workshops. She hosts the Dr. Tamara Beckford Show, where she has interviewed over 165 physicians about self-care, wellness, and the fantastic things they are doing inside and outside clinical medicine. The podcast named after the show is ranked in the top 5% of all podcasts globally.  Dr. Beckford has been a guest on dozens of podcasts and has discussed the importance of wellness on many platforms, including Power to Fly, Scale Your Business Summit, The Grants Professionals Association, CenterPoint Energy, Physician Coach Support, and the Blaze Virtual Summit. She is also a Success Mentor at the EntreMD Business School (EBS), the largest school for physician entrepreneurs in the United States. Dr. Beckford was recognized as a COVID-19 Hero by the New Jersey Academy of Sciences for her work during the pandemic.
speakers.tagLine: Emergency Physician, Wellness Coach, and CEO of UR Caring Docs

speakers.bio:
Tim’s tech career spans over 25 years through various sectors. Tim’s initial journey into tech started in avionics in the US Marine Corps and then into various government contracting roles. After moving to the private sector, Tim worked both in large corporate environments and in small startups, honing his skills in systems administration, automation, architecture, and operations for large cloud-based datastores.
Today, Tim leverages his years in operations, DevOps, and Site Reliability Engineering to advise and consult with the open source and cloud computing communities in his current role. Tim is also a competitive Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu practitioner. He has won the American National and is the 5-time and current reigning Pan American Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu champion in his division.
